Based on your preferences, here are two movie recommendations that might interest you:

  1. "The Clan of the Cave Bear" (2012) directed by Jean-Jacques Rousseau and produced by Pierre-Eudes Bellet. This book tells the story of a tribe living in the cave system at present-day Pennsylvania. The clan is known for their hunting skills, particularly with bow and arrow. However, this clan has also been accused of violence and aggression towards other tribes.
  2. "A Mighty Wind" (2003) directed by Will Arnett and produced by Will Arnett and David Jenkins. This movie tells the story of a concert promoter named James "Jim" Mazzarett (played by Arnett), who is known for his innovative marketing campaigns. However, this concert promoter has also been accused of unethical practices, particularly with regards to artist compensation.
  3. "The Clan of the Cave Bear" and "A Mighty Wind" are two separate movies that have nothing in common other than the fact that they were both directed by Jean-Jacques Rousseau and produced by Pierre-Eudes Bellet.
